posts.post_content:
Nine down, six to go.  The following six examples are the players I need; images come courtesy of the Burdick collection.  Together we have a complete run of all 15 possibilities.  Please let me know if you have or know the existence of any of the following six players:


  * Lady Baldwin
  * Pete Conway
  * Pretzel Getzien
  * Barney Gilligan
  * Ned Hanlon
  * Frank Scheibeck


[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/picture.php?albumid=459&pictureid=23883[/IMG]
2 year bump, still need the same six players.
Good luck Joe.  Stay warm friend.

Hi, Joe,

Alas, I don't have any of them. But I love Baldwin and Getzien's names!

Cheers,
Mike
Joe-Is Hanlon Detroit known with a regular mount, or are they only known with a colored mount? The few I have seen were all Pittsburgh varieties.

Thanks Craig, should break double digits tomorrow for the first time in awhile.  Its all good, was worried we weren't going to see winter this year :)

Mike, good to hear from you . . . Lady & Pretzel were at the heart of the team's success.  Their Old Judge cards, N172 and N173 alike, are near impossible w/ Detroit.

Jay, I've seen two Detroit copies and both are colored mounts (batting pose).  His cabinet with Pittsburgh (1889) appears to be a bit more common (I know of three copies) and of course regular mount (fielding pose).
